PAD_WrongSource.speaker: Player
PAD_WrongSource.text: Nothing. Seems it needs a different source to draw from.

session_synopses.PAD_WrongSource: The regen station failed to work because the character trying to activate it can't be used, e.g. a construct or an undead or similar.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You said it was under control.
ChosenThree.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric and Gortash stand by the chamber's centre, squaring off. Nearby, Orin completes the circle, sitting at her leisure on Ravengard by the brine pool.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: It isn't you I answer to, Gortash.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: Oh, the General voice. Is this where we salute?

ChosenThree.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree.text: Salute, yes, with cleavers through his blood-starved flesh. How it crawls with failure like flies on lick-wet carrion.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: You forget yourself, Orin. I have played my part.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You've built an army for our masters, true enough. But what of the Astral Prism?

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your nose all this time. And you ran from them.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: Sure that they would follow, and deliver it into my hands here. If you would cease these distractions -

DaisyAD_ElderBrain.text: An elder brain... One of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

DaisyAD_EntranceDoor.text: We've found it. The Absolute is behind this door.

PAD_NightsongCaged.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongCaged.text: So long as Nightsong's in that cage, Ketheric will keep getting back up.

AD_Phase3Transition.text: UNLIFE TO MY LIFE - SUSTAIN ME, SLAVES.

AD_NightsongApostle.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongApostle.text: Now you wear a face to match your soul, oathbreaker.
AD_NightsongApostle.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You could have run away. Absconded with the Prism - the one thing that could prevent me from fulfilling my destiny.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: Perhaps you hoped to learn your place in history before you are erased from it. A bright flash of clarity before the snuffing-out.

KethericIntro.speaker: Player
KethericIntro.text: Why is the Prism so important to you?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: The very fact of your being attests to its power - despite your infection, you resisted the brain, here in the heart of its domain.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: What good is an army of thralls if they do not obey their master?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My Lord Myrkul gave me the one thing I desired - the one thing that no other god could grant me.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My daughter's life returned. Her heart beating once more.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: For that, he asked that I serve as his Chosen, join Orin and Gortash to grow the cult of the Absolute, and then... take control of it.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: He's never had a more devoted follower.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I have fought great wars before, in the service of other gods, and other powers. But for Myrkul, I would condemn all of Faer√ªn to death.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You are all that stands between me and my destiny - and you have brought the Prism here.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I will kill you now. And then I will raise you as my servant.

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.text: Impossible... death cannot take me... I am its master...
KethericDefeated.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle lurches back as the final blow is struck. It sinks towards the ground, growing more insubstantial as it falls. 

It fades to nothing, leaving only Ketheric, who staggers, holding a hand to a bloody wound over his heart

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: calling out to his god, hands held wide, displaying the wound for the cameraNodeContext: growing desperation as you call on your god

KethericDefeated.text: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: head bowed, he speaks from his knees, fear in his voiceNodeContext: fear in your voice - tried to speak to your god, but there was no response

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.text: You... you have no idea what you've done.

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext:  he locks eyes with the player on the first 'you', a horrified expression on his face. The flesh falls away after he has spoken, leaving only a skull, that crashes to the ground, rolling away from his armour, now containing little but dust and shattered bones

PAD_AfterCombatComment.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombatComment.text: The Chosen of Myrkul is dead - permanently, this time.
PAD_AfterCombatComment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's distracted. More focused on Gortash.

AD_KethericInvulnerable.text: Have you not learned? I am beyond death, fool.

DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone.text: Ketheric's Netherstone - it's in his armour. Take it.

AD_IsobelKilled.context: NodeContext: More fury than grief. We killed his daughter - but he'll bring her back again

AD_IsobelKilled.text: My Lord brought her back once already. Your death will be final.

session_synopses.ChosenThree: Upon entering the Ketheric boss chamber on the lower floor of the Colony, the party will see a cinematic of the Chosen Three gearing up to continue on to the next stage of their master plan. Ketheric, Orin and Gortash will be discussing the next steps and the tension caused by the player's actions. Ketheric tadpoles Duke Ravengard and we lay eyes upon the Elder Brain in the flesh. Orin and Gortash depart with the Duke and the Elder Brain in a nearby Nautiloid to march onto Baldur's Gate. We see the Nautiloid appear above Moonrise Towers and cue the armies of the Absolute to start marching. Ketheric stays behind to deal with some local issues.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_ElderBrain: The Elder Brain. One of the cruelest and most powerful creatures that exist. Subservient to those three. And those gems seem to be the key. We must obtain them.
session_synopses.PAD_NightsongCaged: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, while the combat has started and Nightsong is still soul caged. The players must free her before Ketheric can be damaged. Once the first (speaker available) player gets their turn in combat, this AD will play on them.
session_synopses.AD_Phase3Transition: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the third phase of the fight starts, this will play only once on Ketheric when his turn starts. Ketheric, in his Apostle of Myrkul form, calls upon the Necromites to sacrifice themselves to heal him.
session_synopses.AD_NightsongApostle: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, after Ketheric has transformed into his Apostle form/reached his second stage, Nightsong will react to this upon her first combat turn after this.
session_synopses.KethericIntro: This dialog plays at the start of the Ketheric boss fight in the Colony. There are numerous permutations here: Nightsong being dead or alive, freed from her soul cage (through stealth before being spotted); Isobel being absent or tadpoled or tadpoled and killed (in the boss chamber) before entering the dialog; Jaheira being present here (and spotted) or being absent.
session_synopses.KethericDefeated: NOTE TO PITSTOP: We have a cinematic previz of this so be sure to ping for that if we haven't already sent it to you.This dialog plays after defeating Ketheric once and for all at the Colony Ketheric Showdown. Ketheric delivers a short speech before he dies.- If Nightsong's corpse is present in the chamber, she will revive. If she is alive by this point she will comment on finally being rid of Ketheric.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCombatComment: A PAD commenting on defeating Ketheric in his Apostle form at the end of the mind flayer Colony. After this the player will say that they need to go discuss the next course of action with their allies (alluding to Intermezzo in Moonrise Tower).At this point the players should take Ketheric's Netherstone (but we can't ensure that a player hasn't already looted said netherstone off his corpse by the time that end node is played).If there are two players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.
session_synopses.AD_KethericInvulnerable: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player tries to damage Ketheric while he is invulnerable (Nightsong is still in the soul cage). Ketheric will react to the damage attempt. This will play if Ketheric is in his human form.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone: After the fight with Ketheric, Daisy asks us to grab Ketheric's Netherstone.
session_synopses.AD_IsobelKilled: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player kills Isobel during the combat. Ketheric will react to this in human form.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Player
Corpse_Dead.text: You saw the Absolute? Tell me what She looked like.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Corpse
Corpse_Dead.context: NodeContext: Starts out blissful, then actual recollection - vague puzzlement and horror

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The Speak With Dead dialog for the default fallback corpse that drops from the Cleansing Chute corpse. This corpse only appears when another minor character (presumably one of the tieflings) shouldn't end up dead here for some reason.

DaisyAD_ThroughHole_SkippedPrison.text: This is an illithid colony. The source of the tadpoles must be in here, somewhere.
Tread carefully. That telepathic storm is now a tempest.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_ThroughHole_SkippedPrison: On arrival in colony. If through hole in tower and you did not go through prison

Memory_Foreshadowing.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Foreshadowing.text: They won't be laughing much longer. Won't be any more of this 'No gnomes in the City Watch, Brevin'.
Memory_Foreshadowing.context: NodeContext: Bitter but dazed mutterings - not aware of player's presence, or that they're just a brain in a jar

Memory_Foreshadowing.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Foreshadowing.text: This Gortash fella's got an idea. Kind of a training camp. Don't know how it gets me into the watch, but he seems the smart sort...
Memory_Foreshadowing.context: NodeContext: Bitter but dazed mutterings - not aware of player's presence, or that they're just a brain in a jar

session_synopses.Memory_Foreshadowing: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" foreshadows Mamzell Amira, a character from the serial killer questline in act 3/Baldur's Gate.

PAD_Manuscripts.speaker: Player
PAD_Manuscripts.text: Seems I can understand illithid script. Thank you, tadpole.

session_synopses.PAD_Manuscripts: This dialog plays upon rolling a passive Arcana check after reading one of the illithid manuscripts in the lower Colony's Memory Library.For tadpoled companions, each companion will see this check once, after reading an illithid manuscript, unless someone else has succeeded this check.For non-tadpoled companions, a different check occurs when they try to read the illithid manuscripts. As they do not have a tadpole, they can't read the script, and will remark on this. A different Arcana Check occurs in script, and the resulting AD from this check will also play again everytime they try to read an illithid manuscript afterwards.So for non-tadpoled companions (no ILLITHID tag) this dialog is repeatable, but not for tadpoled companions.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A whole fleet of nautiloids. How many 'True Souls' have passed through this place?

session_synopses.PAD: While exploring the Colony, a player arrives at a precipice from which they can see a row of floating nautiloids.

AD_Us_FollowPlayer.speaker: Us
AD_Us_FollowPlayer.text: We must flee - lead Us to safety, friend.

AD_Butcher_Idle.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Idle.text: Pretty faces go chop... faces? No - no faces, only meat. Never think, never stop. Only chop. Chop. CHOP.
AD_Butcher_Idle.context: NodeContext: Brief note of lucidity on '...faces?' as he seems momentarily aware of his condition - then shakes it off and returns to his work rhythm a little more forcefully.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.context: NodeContext: Recognition/excited ('helm' referencing their previous adventures to get to a nautiloid helm during the tutorial)

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: We remember you well. You saved Us once. Perhaps you can do it again?

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They are not kind to Us here. We are different, they say. Aberrant.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They wish to repurpose Us - destroy what they cannot fix. Please, help Us escape harm!

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: Oh, thank you, thank you! You are a good friend - no, more. Rescuer.

session_synopses.AD_Us_FollowPlayer: This AD plays upon freeing Us from its cage in the Colony Morgue, without triggering a crime reaction from Chop, the Colony Butcher. In that case, Us will start following the first player they see (or the player that got them out) and request to get out of the Morgue and to safety.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Idle: Sequential, repeated AD for Chop, the Colony butcher. He will say a line every few seconds while in his idle behaviour. Chop is generally enjoying his job, but something deep beneath his enthralled exterior realizes the horror of his reality. Some of these lines could be considered a little bit song-like - Chop would be humming to himself while working.
session_synopses.Us: Default dialogue with Us while they are in the Colony. Us is either locked in a cage in the Morgue, trying to sneak away from the Butcher, or thanking you for saving them, after which they will disappear.

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *Desperation... pain... terror. Cultists raided his village - he was the sole survivor.*

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *You remember the shattered windows of Elturel's High Cathedral, the burning black sky of Avernus beyond.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *In its horror, the Blood War unites you. Tiefling, dwarf and elf alike huddle behind the shields of your paladin order, waiting for salvation. But when it comes... disunity.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *The returned city casts your people out, the devils who dragged them down to hell. In the end, it is not your paladin oath that is broken: it is your faith itself.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *You connect to the device, and gain control of the pods - and the fate of their occupants.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *The device is open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.text: An unusual parasite, here. It's - it's reaching out to me.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *Courage... conviction... defiance. Even as her organs began to dissolve, she believed she could resist.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *Delirium... mania... laughter. His mind broke before the end, and he was laughing uncontrollably as the skin fell from his face.*

DaisyAD_BrinePool.text: Brine pools... but empty of tadpoles. Unusual. Harvesting all the larvae indicates they are getting ready for something big.

AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

PAD_MizoraPodComment.speaker: Player
PAD_MizoraPodComment.text: That pod - is that Mizora inside?

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *Your lungs burn with the dry heat of the fires raging about you, but the pain is not enough to diminish your swing. One goblin after another falls to your blade.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *A man's voice cries out through the thick smoke. 'Ravengard!' you call, but the clang of swords and the spell-shouts of attacking drow are your only reply.*

AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.text: This place has been used to make slaves of those who should be masters.

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *This mind-flayer pod is not only empty, it looks abandoned.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *This pod has a different air to its chitinous cavern. Dust and dirt gather on the inside.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *This pod's inhabitant must have taken a lot of damage while they were inside.*

PostCombat_Manip.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip.text: Hurr, what a stench. I'm beginning to think I should have stayed in that pod. In there it only smelled like me.

PostCombat_Manip.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip.text: Is there any news about Duke Ravengard? Did he get out alive? No, I can tell by your expression. I'm going to have to fall on my sword, aren't I?

session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer: AD for a memory imprint on an empty pod in the Tadpoling Centre.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor: AD for Zevlor's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before he was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.Pods: Interacting with the mind flayer device in the Tadpoling Centre that controls the pods inside. You get to choose whether to free or purge the occupants of the pods - mind flayers and innocents alike.
session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole: The party reacts to spotting a special tadpole in one of the brine pools of the Colony Tadpoling Centre. It can be used for the tadpole powers tree.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_BrinePool: Brine pools. But they‚Äôve been harvested. They should be full of tadpoles.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from whoever was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.PAD_MizoraPodComment: Players comment when approaching Mizora's pod in the back of the Tadpoling Centre, provided she is there.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva: AD for Flaming Fist Yeva's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.DarkUrgePod: A player character interacts with a pod in the Tadpoling Centre that once belonged to the Dark Urge character. Other player characters may also investigate the pod, and imply something about who the pod belonged to if they succeed a skill check.
session_synopses.PostCombat_Manip: Dialogue with a Flaming Fist Manip, Ravengard's search officer, after freeing her from her pod in the Colony Tadpoling Centre.

DaisyAD_GrandDesignReaction.text: The Grand Design. The restoration of the mind flayer empire. The dream of all illithids.

PAD_PuzzleSolved.speaker: Player
PAD_PuzzleSolved.text: That should do it. Time to see what's back there.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_GrandDesignReaction: Daisy reacts to seeing an illithid sculpture of the Grand Design.
session_synopses.PAD_PuzzleSolved: The party reacts to solving the mind flayer "mind puzzle" in the Colony Vault, near the Necro-Lab. Solving the puzzle unlocks a door where you can find the rewards.

PAD_RitualArea.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualArea.text: Curious setup. Think I'll keep my distance.

AD_Zombie.speaker: Cal, Danis, Dror Ragzlin, GROUP_Act2_COL_NecromancerZombies, Lakrissa, Lia, Nickels, Nightwarden Minthara, Nimble, Wulbren Bongle

session_synopses.PAD_RitualArea: The players come upon a ritual setup where subjects are captured and held in glass containers while the magic drains their life and turns them into undead.
session_synopses.AD_Zombie: The player interacts with a zombie in the necromancer's lab,

PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.text: Of all the beastly lairs I've had to poke my nose into - an illithid colony is still by far the worst.
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.context: InternalNodeContext:  Referencing Bhaalspawn/Abdel (Unsure if it's a canon adventure? Might be)

PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.speaker: Player
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.text: I think we have more pressing concerns than a trip down memory lane.

session_synopses.PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn: Jaheira comments about returning to a mindflayer colony, which Laez'al, Wyll and Astarion comment on. It's mentioned that this is Jaheira reflecting on coming to one of these with Abdel Adrian,

session_synopses.Butcher: This dialog is started by talking to the Butcher character in the Colony. The player may ask the Butcher questions or recruit them as a temporary follower inside the Colony. Alternatively, this dialog runs through a flag in case the player has already met the Butcher, or if the Butcher was recruited as a follower. The Butcher sounds eerily vacant unless otherwise specified, his mind destroyed by his time in Colony.

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Is anyone else's tadpole squirming around a lot more than usual?

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Aye. Feels like something down here has them excited... or scared.

session_synopses.PAD_CallLiftFail: The player has tried to call the platform in COL while it's already at the level in question.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorBanter: A banter PAD when taking the elevator down to the Ketheric Showdown from the upper floor of the Colony. If there are two tadpoled players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.

session_synopses.AD_Rapid05: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.
session_synopses.AD_Rapid03: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.

PAD_DefeatedKetheric.speaker: Player
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.text: An elder brain... That was the Heart of the Absolute?
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.context: NodeContext: Almost to self, processing this information

session_synopses.ResonanceStone_PAD: The players react to gaining or losing the "Eldritch Pleasure" status effect from the Resonance Stone in the secret sideroom of the Colony kitchen/dissection room. This status is applied or removed upon gaining the "Eldritch Pleasure" buff bestowed by the aura effect of the Resonance Stone, and will only play once per user and nearby player. The removal dialog will only trigger upon losing the buff while inside a trigger near the Colony kitchen, as to avoid it playing unexpectedly during later parts of the game.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I found Mol's eyepatch.

node_data.speaker: Umi
node_data.text: What? Where is she?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Rising tearful panic

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hey, calm down - I'm sure she just dropped it. Mol's fine, I promise.

node_data.speaker: Umi
node_data.text: You think so? Mol is really clever. I hope she finds us again soon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hovering on the brink of tears despite the player's reassurances

session_synopses: Umi is upset by Mol's absence and is just barely holding it together (despite Alfira's best attempts).

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: You killed the dead man. I'm impressed.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: And now your path takes you to Baldur's Gate. I shall walk that path with you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No - you're staying here in the shadows.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I go where my enemies are, and they are not here in the shadows. They are in Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: And they will pose a greater threat than Ketheric.
CinematicNodeContext: Leaves throne, standing from here on
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaves throne, standing from here on

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: We must be free if we are to rule - and to be free, we must destroy this cult, and Ketheric's co-conspirators along with it.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I know one of them all too well - Bhaal's blood-letter, Orin.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: To think I thought her to be speaking for the Absolute. I worshipped that woman.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: An old flame?

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Jealous? You needn't be -  when Orin is in my hands, her agony will nourish me.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: She is the iblith who indoctrinated me with the Absolute's lies.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Indeed, she is the one who indoctrinated me with the Absolute's lies.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: There was another with Ketheric - Gortash. Do you know anything about him?

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Only that he serves Bane, which could make him a petty lordling, or a despot capable of bending the world to his will.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: That he has enslaved illithids to fulfil his ambitions strongly suggests he is the latter.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: The Harper may know more - her precious Baldur's Gate was the soil that nourished his growth.

session_synopses: After the SCE debrief, Minthara sits on Ketheric's throne and dreams of what lies ahead.

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Mol would've shanked him up proper.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fond but slightly wistful (Mol is missing)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where are the others?

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: I've put them to use scavenging supplies for the journey.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Once they've packed up everything, I'll be leading us all on to Baldur's Gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The others are in good hands - looking forward to seeing you at Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Oh you most definitely will, pal.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Chuffed at the implication he can handle the task

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: In fact, I bet we'll even get there first.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Playful

session_synopses: Mattis is quietly worried by Mol's disappearance but is trying to put a brave face on. In the absence of Alfira and Cerys, he is preparing to lead the tieflings to Baldur's Gate himself.

PAD_ToBaldursGate.speaker: Player
PAD_ToBaldursGate.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is west of the town. If we hurry, we'll arrive before the Absolute's forces.

session_synopses.PAD_ToBaldursGate: After leaving Ketheric's throne room after Ketheric's defeat, a player character comments on what they need to do next - head for Baldur's Gate.

000.speaker: Flaming Fist
000.text: Safely on to Baldur's Gate. For all of us.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: There you are. I was wondering where the devil you'd been.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Here I am. What do you want?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: To talk about Wulbren, of course.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Impatiently

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Who? Oh - right. Well, forget about that magungus. We have more important things to worry about. Like Wulbren.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'muh-GUN-guss' (hard g's).

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What about him?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Wulbren and the Ironhand Gnomes are planning something dreadful in the city.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: They have runepowder. They have motive. We have to stop them.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How can you be sure?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Because they're a gaggle of vindictive crybabies with no sense of propriety.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: That is to say, they gabbed about their plans like geese, and I overheard them, like a very devious goose.

session_synopses: He's a bit mopey but is very much wanting to stick by Wulbren's side despite being mistreated by him. He doesn't know what's happening next but he knows Wulbren has a plan. So that's something.

Umi.speaker: Umi
Umi.text: Maybe I should ask the grown-ups to look for Mol again.

Cerys.speaker: Cerys
Cerys.text: What will we do once we reach the city? No - one problem a time.
Cerys.context: NodeContext: a little stern with herself - she knows it's too easy to catastrophise

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Just focus on packing - don't think about Mol.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: It's finally time for the Ironhand Gnomes to come home.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: eager, excited to return to the city

Alfira.speaker: Alfira
Alfira.text: I hope the kids liked it...

session_synopses.UnfortunateGnome: This occurs in the epilogue. In the top set Wulbren has died and barcus is considering his next steps. In the bottom, Wulbren is alive and barcus is determined to do everything he can to help him.
session_synopses.Umi: Umi is worried about Mol, who is missing. In the top set, the player has down Umi Mol's eyepatch - hinting that she's dead. She's scared for her friend. In the bottom set, she's anxiously worried for her friend.
session_synopses.Cerys: This AD occurs in the epilogue of Act 2. With Zevlor dead, cerys has stepped up to lead the tieflings. She muses about what they need to make it to the city.
session_synopses.Mattis: In the top nodes, the player has shown Mattis mol's eyepatch - implying that she's dead. He's distracted and just trying to focus on packing and getting ready - even though he's worried for Mol. In the bottom, he's eager to go and is scavaging Moonrise for stuff he can sell.
session_synopses.Wulbren: These ADs occur in the epilogue. In one set, Wulbren is admiring the stonework in front of him, and contemplating the artistry of Moonrise Towers. In the other, it's his idle behaviour as he prepares to leave for Baldur's Gate - excited for his plans to all come together.
session_synopses.Alfira: This AD occurs in the epilogue of Act 2, as Alfira is keeping an eye on the kids. Mol is missing and they're really worried. She muses about she can do to cheer them up/is riding a high after performing with the player in the hopes of cheering the kids up.

DaisyJournalBegin.text: We leave the heart of the Absolute, alive, thanks to you.
You did well to defeat Ketheric. But Ketheric was only the first to fall.
There are many more battles ahead, and they will not be so easily won. You will need allies.

DaisyJournalBegin.speaker: Player
DaisyJournalBegin.text: I don't need allies, I have you.
I may be the one who protects you, but it is you who must champion the cause.

session_synopses.DaisyJournalBegin: Daisy sets you on the mission to gather allies upon trying to leave SCE. Entire dialogue is telepathic (Daisy does not show up in the world.)

001.speaker: Flaming Fist
001.text: We should march. Rest, maybe - then march.

AD_EpilogueIntro.speaker: Withers
AD_EpilogueIntro.text: Against all odds, thou hast survived. Wilt thou reflect with me upon thy triumph?

AD.speaker: Withers
AD.text: Make haste. I would have words with you.
AD.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: The shadows yet fester. The Dead Three, united under cover of darkness. The balance shifts.

Debrief.speaker: Narrator
Debrief.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

Debrief.speaker: Narrator
Debrief.text: *All three sowed chaos at the height of their power. And all three now walk the planes as mortals - or so it's believed.*

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: There are depths to this alliance yet unplumbed. Consider, mortal:

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: Forget that. Who are you? What are you doing here?

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: I shall ask yet again. Do illithids possess souls?

session_synopses.AD_EpilogueIntro: Withers AD's on the player successfully defeating Ketheric and coming back to the Epilogue.
session_synopses.AD: Jergal is always present at the epilogue and will try to call for the player's attention. He has important things to say to the player in his debrief about the dead three and what to do next. It will only play before SCE_Jergal_Debrief triggers.
session_synopses.Debrief: Jergal's debrief at MOO after the mind flayer colony.

002.speaker: Nickels
002.text: It'll take time, but this tower's stone will heal.

session_synopses.002: Eagerly awaiting the next steps from their leader Wulbren. Ready to do whatever he directs. If Wulbren or Nimble are dead, he'll be noticably more downbeat.

AD_MainGateFlamingFists.speaker: Flaming Fist
AD_MainGateFlamingFists.text: I ought to do the rounds again.

AD_MainGateFlamingFists.speaker: Flaming Fist
AD_MainGateFlamingFists.text: No point. Everyone's wrecked. Leave 'em be.

session_synopses.AD_MainGateFlamingFists: Two flaming fists at the main gate of MOO are guarding it and discussing how finally they will be able to leave the cursed lands and go back to Baldur's Gate, and that they didn't think they would make it.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: You have defeated Ketheric Thorm, yet you who were content to leave Dame Aylin in his thrall until it served you best. How do you account for it?

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Isobel is dead. But you live - you who were content to leave me in the thrall of foul Ketheric Thorm.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It was strategy - not personal.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Not personal for you, perhaps. You played a game of life and death, using mine as a chip in your pile.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I will not forget it. But nor will I turn down a powerful ally in the fight for Faer√ªn.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I am Dame Aylin. Daughter of the Moonmaiden, Sel√ªne; champion of her causes in this fine realm.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: If you seek to protect it, our aims are aligned - even if you've much to learn about the methods of a true champion.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I will join your camp, that we may discuss what must needs be discussed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No need to wait. I freed you so I could kill Ketheric, but I have no interest in an alliance.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: You would deny Dame Aylin, daughter of the Moonmaiden, paladin of the selfsame Sel√ªne?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I would.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Reject the moon, if it be your will. It will not stop her from lending you her light. Good day.

session_synopses: The player has a chance to catch up with Nightsong if she survived Act 2, and Isobel is dead

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Still rattled by what happened at the Emerald Grove, they'll need time to recover before they'll be ready to talk.*

session_synopses: Triggers if Halsin tries to talk to any of the Tiefling refugees in Haven

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: It's those damn shadows. Be ready!
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation. [Astarion - realises the shadows are attacking]

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: No hesitation - these people are long dead.
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation.

session_synopses.ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat: SCL Haven: Isobel is kidnapped/killed and shadows engulf the inn, combat starts against the shadows. Players find themselves in the middle of it protecting the inn or just because they haven't escaped.

AD_StartLoverPromenade.speaker: Bex
AD_StartLoverPromenade.text: So... shall we go for a walk?

AD_StartLoverPromenade.speaker: Danis
AD_StartLoverPromenade.text: Anywhere, my love - I go where you go.

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: Bex isn't easily offended, so gods know what you said to upset her so much.
Danis.context: NodeContext: If the player really offended Bex earlier, Danis reacts. He's still grateful to the player, but wary now.

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: After everything you've done for us, she'll come around eventually, I'm sure.

session_synopses.AD_StartLoverPromenade: Bex and Danis just before setting off for a walk around Haven after being reunited.
session_synopses.Danis: Danis' dialog in Haven after his rescue.He has made it safely to Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers and has been reunited with Bex, his partner, if she's alive, or is alone if she's not. If she's alive, the player witnessed a really cute reunion between them, and these dialogues cover Danis' followups to that conversation, as well as versions for if he's alone and for a few states in Haven. Not all states are covered since Danis doesn't care much about Ketheric

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002.text: The General will be pleased if you go quietly.

AD_Jaheira_IsobelCombat_002.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_IsobelCombat_002.text: Rout the Absolute's poison from this place.

DiscoveredHaven.text: This place is protected. You might find allies here, or at least supplies.

node_data.text: Heading out without Isobel's blessing? Have you got a death wish?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Far from it - thanks for the reminder.
Hate to see the shadows get you before you've begun. Good luck.

session_synopses: Could be one of a number of Last Light guards who sees you leaving without getting the blessing from Isobel and calls out to you to remind you.

AD_Blackboard.speaker: Narrator
AD_Blackboard.text:
*Mug of ale, 4 cp
Chopped cheek, 3 sp
Daily special, inquire*
AD_Blackboard.context:
NodeContext: Reading a menu.
CP = copper piece
SP = silver piece (but for voice just 'sp'  and 'cp' is fine

PAD_SeluneShrine.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SeluneShrine.context: NodeContext: Arc - SH is loyal to shar

PAD_SeluneShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluneShrine.text: Perhaps they had no choice but to hide.

session_synopses.AD_Blackboard: Comment on the blackboard in Haven
session_synopses.PAD_SeluneShrine: Comment on the Selunite shrine at 35; 0; -694 in Haven.

AD_Combat_Jaheira_000.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Combat_Jaheira_000.text: You should have stayed in your tower.

AD_Combat_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
AD_Combat_HarperQuartermaster.text: Get back in the trash pile where you belong!

node_data.speaker: Ox
node_data.text: Glad to see you made it. I am, indeed I am.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Glad to see you made it, too.

node_data.speaker: Ox
node_data.text: I remember you from the grove with the druids. I hoped I'd see you again. And now I have.

session_synopses: The player talks to an Ox. This is the same creature as S_DEN_Mule_001, Peter Hannah

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I promised you a drink the next time we met. This inn isn't what I had in mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Smiling, happy to see us, but muted. She's suffered tragedy since we last saw her.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I owe you an apology. You pulled my people from one death-trap, only for me to land them in another.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing serious - in her mind, she messed up the chance we gave her

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How did you blunder into danger this time?

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: ...I suppose I deserve that.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little stiff - primed to take offense but relaxes, accepts the insult is probably warranted

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I was trying to scout a path for us while you got busy carving one. But don't worry, I've had my fill of fighting since.
node_data.context: NodeContext: wry, but ending on a somber note

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Aye, and more than half the others with him.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: We were ambushed out in the cursed lands - cultists of this Absolute. Likely we should have surrendered, but...

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: They were toying with us. Making examples. And we'd had enough of taking it.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Those of us who cut free just kept running 'til we found this place. The others... maybe the cult got them. Maybe the curse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, helpless. It's not that she doesn't care what happened to them, but she's exhausted and knows there's little she can do

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What are you doing out here to begin with? You were bound for Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: This army of the Absolute is growing, and flowing towards Moonrise. There's worse than goblins on the roads now.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Ominous, frustrated. They met much more resistance than she imagined

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I thought we might pass unnoticed along the fringes of this place. Escape the owlbear by hiding in its shadow, so to speak.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: You can see exactly how well that went.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Making light of her own foolish plan. Not jokey, just tired - her failure is self-evident

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sounds like you made a right mess of things.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Aye, I did. Maybe you'd have been the one to save us all, if you'd been there.
node_data.context: NodeContext: No pretense - she openly accepts she abandoned some people, but has to be pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Or maybe you'd be missing along with the rest.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Stark - not trying to provoke or insult us, just stating facts

session_synopses: Cerys, a tiefling scout, is now present in Last Light along with the others who evaded capture by the cultists. She has reluctantly assumed the role of leader in Zevlor's absence (assuming she hadn't already). She's exhausted by the responisibility but still capable of a little gallows humour.

DismissesHalsin.speaker: Narrator
DismissesHalsin.text: *The Flaming Fist looks past your shoulder; it seems he'd prefer not to speak to you.*

session_synopses.DismissesHalsin: Narrator line for the situation where Halsin tries to talk to Marcus while marcus is waiting to talk to a True Soul

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: full of gratitude

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: It's not much, but here - you deserve it.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: You're here. You're all right - how?
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: her friend, who she thought was dead, is safe and well. Astonished, grateful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty.text: We're 'two tiefling queens', remember? I couldn't leave my favourite bard without her partner in crime.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: alfira thought lakrissa dead - lakrissa is enjoying seeing alfira's face and is being playful and cheeky

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I did have some help from an old friend though.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: reference to player, grateful and playful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: still astonished, trying to figure out how player managed to save lakrissa

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty.text: Killing everyone who got in my way.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: grateful - knows player had to hurt people to save her friend.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I never thought I'd see... well, anyone, again.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS REWARDNodeContext: Delighted and grateful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: Thank you - a thousand times, thank you. One last favour? Take this off my hands - it suits you better.

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty.text: Anything happen while I was away?
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: trying to make convo but she's actually worried for alfira

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty.text: Too much. I can't wait for things to just be... quiet.
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: little bit tired and down but trying not to sound it.

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty.text: It'll be quiet in the city. We'll have a little house, maybe a garden?
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: sincere and heartfelt - trying to make alfira smile

session_synopses.Bard: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
session_synopses.ReunionWithFlirty: Lakrissa has been resuced from Moonrise by the player and is reunuined with her closest friend, Alfira.
session_synopses.AD_WithFlirty: This occurs after alfira and lakrissa have their reunion scene in last light (player has rescued lakrissa from moonrise). Lakrissa and Alfira are being cute and concenered for each other.

session_synopses.ARENA_Wave0: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 0 of enemies spawning

AD_LoverInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_LoverInspection.text: We have to worry about parasites now? Gods.

AD_BrotherInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_BrotherInspection.text: I would tell you if I had one, I swear it!

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Manip Vidor
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: J'ehlar is doing her best, but he shows no signs of waking.

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: If you have an alternative in mind, please do propose it.

AD_WulbrenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WulbrenInspection.text: This is ridiculous - as if I'd let some parasite infect me.
AD_WulbrenInspection.context: NodeContext: Loathing in his voice at the thought

FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling.text: The light - it's happening. Ketheric is about to get a long overdue arse-kicking - I can feel it.

AD_SisterInspection.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterInspection.text: Can we hurry this up? I need a drink. Now.
AD_SisterInspection.context: NodeContext: annoyed and a little nervous

FlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Thadwick
FlamingFist_001.text: This is no place for amateurs.
FlamingFist_001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: now annoyed that player is talking again

FlamingFist_002.speaker: Fist Aubree
FlamingFist_002.text: I've heard the stories about Moonrise. I hope the Duke is all right.
FlamingFist_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: concerned

FlamingFist_003.speaker: Fist Rahir
FlamingFist_003.text: Nothing to be done here. The Duke's in the Towers.
FlamingFist_003.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: strict but coming from a good place

Arrival.speaker: Narrator
Arrival.text: *You drift through the dark until time, skill, or luck brings you to Last Light's dock.*
Arrival.context: CinematicNodeContext: Screen is black. As the narration ends, it fades up to reveal players and prisoners standing on the dock with the Harper walking towards them

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: Hold there! You can't just land and start unloading strangers - there are procedures, damn it.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: No one gets in without being tested - Commander Jaheira's orders.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: We'll process this lot, but you need to come with me. The Commander will want a word.

AD_Gnome02Inspection.speaker: Nickels
AD_Gnome02Inspection.text: I want to go inside - to the wood and stone. Where it's quiet - safe.

FlamingFist_004.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
FlamingFist_004.text: A hundred years locked away inside a curse - can you imagine?
FlamingFist_004.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

FlamingFist_006.speaker: Fist Cyril
FlamingFist_006.text: I'd offer to help, but with Duke Ravengard missing, we can't spare anyone. I'm sorry.
FlamingFist_006.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: sincere and emotive - you care deeply and are worried for the player's loved ones

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: Heard you're meant to be heading toward the Towers.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: 'A good soldier knows when he isn't the man for the job.' So sayeth Florrick.
Manip.context: NodeContext: With a bit of a bitter edge. He's not super pissed, but isn't happy.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: If you find us a way into the Towers, we'll be there, shield to shield. Until then... we wait.

AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.speaker: Fist Rahir
AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.context: NodeContext: battle cry - determined and unafraid despite being outnumbered

AD_FlamingFist_001_CouncillorDefeated.speaker: Fist Thadwick
AD_FlamingFist_001_CouncillorDefeated.text: The Cousellor's fallen - Fists, don't give up!

ArrivalInspector.speaker: Harper Arthus
ArrivalInspector.text: Keep your distance. Let's not confuse the parasite.

session_synopses.AD_LoverInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_ArguingWithFlorrick: Florrick and Vidor are talking between themselves about how to proceed. Florrick wants to wait until Mart Cullagh is awake and can tell them more about the shadowcurse. Vidor wants to plan an attack on Moonrise Towers to rescue Grand Duke Ravengard. They aren't at cross purposes, but they don't agree on much.
session_synopses.AD_WulbrenInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlirtyTiefling: Lakrissa's dialogue after her reunion scene with alfira (or potentially this is her only scene if alfira is dead). Lakrissa is usually playful and flirty but she is a but more restrained here. Still smiling but more somber.
session_synopses.AD_SisterInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_001: Thadwick is a male dwarf and grumpy is his middle name. He's a bit rough and gruff and has little time for the player - an amateur in his eyes. He warms up to him slightly as we progress through the dialogue. This dialogue cover his major states in Haven.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_002: Flaming Fist Aubree is devoted to the Ravengard but also pragmatic. She's unafraid of asking for the player's help and is concerned for Ravengard. Does her best to look at things in a non-judgemental way.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_003: Flaming Fist Rahir is a stern solider who admires Duke Ravengard. He is tough and nonense.
session_synopses.Arrival: Standing on a dock, the Player's just arrived back in Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers with a boat of prisoners seeking sanctuary. A surprised Harper greets you and says he'll need to test the new arrivals.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome02Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_004: A mercenary with the Flaming Fist, stuck in Haven with the refugees and one too pleased about it.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_006: Flaming Fist Cyril is an elf who feels things deeply. An emotive person, he is positive and tries to see the good in everything.  This dialogue contains several states, including resting, on high alert against ghouls, under attack etc..
session_synopses.Manip: The Flaming FIst Manip, Vidor, has conflict with Florrick prior to any of these dialogues. He is the sergeant of the FF troops, and believes Florrick is a terrible leader. Player can respond to his idea that he should attack Moonrise.
session_synopses.ArrivalInspector: The Harper Inspecter is either looking over a batch of prisoners who've just arrived in Moonrise or has just finished inspecting them and is walking away when the player intercepts him. A gruff and suspicious guard.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was joking, this morning. Yonas, I mean.
Harper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks up to stand behind Meygan, but she doesn't look at them.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: There was an ambush in the dark. The shadows dragged him away...

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was always joking. Said it was good for morale, but he just liked seeing people laugh.
Harper_001.context: NodeContext: Small pause before the line.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was a good Harper. A good friend...
Harper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after finishing this line

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I thought we could have been something more, one day, but...
Harper_001.context: NodeContext: Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

Harper_001.speaker: Player
Harper_001.text: Hey - it will be all right.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: No, he... Sorry, I - I'd like to be alone.

Harper_003.speaker: Harper Karrow
Harper_003.text: We lost a good one today. Yonas. He was green as they come, poor kid.
Harper_003.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.NodeContext: Reflecting on a dead soldier

AD_Arrival_Harper_003.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_Arrival_Harper_003.text: Wasn't sure we'd see light again.

session_synopses.AD_Arrival_Harper_001: Single-shot AD when the Harpers arrive back into Haven from the ambush in the shadow-curse where one of their own, Yonas, is killed by shadow creatures. Relieved but sad.
session_synopses.Harper_001: Dialogue with Meygan in Last Light. She is standing before an altar, mourning Yonas' death. She might give us something if we give her his sword. Despite changes in the state of the grove, she usually reverts to her normal dialogue/ state of sadness as she was close to Yonas and that's more to the front of her mind than stuff like Ketheric
session_synopses.Harper_003: Harper Scout's default dialogue through several states in Haven.
session_synopses.AD_Arrival_Harper_003: One-shot Harper AD after arriving back in Haven post the attack on the Harper contingent that leaves Yonas dead. Sad but relieved.

DouseTorch.speaker: Narrator
DouseTorch.text: *The denizens of Last Light are fed up with your reckless torch-dousing in the face of the shadow curse.*

session_synopses.DouseTorch: Darkness causes death in SCL. As such, Haven npcs consider dousing torches as a crime. This crime has one warning.

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *The eye focuses on you, taking in every detail of your appearance.*

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *As far as you can tell, it is a simple construct designed to provide additional security.*

session_synopses.Eye: A dialogue you can have with any of the scrying eyes that patrol moonrise towers. It was written to give a hint that Gortash/one of his cronies are watching you from beyond.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning.text: Halt. I know neither your stride nor your bearing.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning.text: Disciples may enter. All others are to be culled, by the General's decree.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
TrespassWarning.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning.text: I work for the General. Perhaps he should hear of your insolence.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning.text: I know my orders. For the Absolute.

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Ugh. There's blood on these cards.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: After noticing some gore on her cards

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Aye. My brother's. Had to deal with him after he struck a True Soul - claimed she was some kind of monster.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Mild, barely looking up from his hand

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Had to toss him over that terrace there.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Only the vaguest regret - as if murdering his own brother was an unfortunate duty

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Mute shock at what she's just heard

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: God. We belong to just the one now, remember.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: First edge in his voice. Firmly clarifying that he won't brook any blasphemy against his god

session_synopses.TrespassWarning: A guard questions intruding players on the upper floor of Moonrise Tower
session_synopses.AD_ImpatientGuards: Idle banter between two guards of rhe Absolute. One is young and eager for battle, the other is more seasoned and relaxed - but reveals himself to be a fanatic true believer

AD_WithGuard000.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard000.context: NodeContext: Snapping at an underling bothering her

AD_WithGuard000.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_WithGuard000.text: The shipments are progressing, Disciple. Though I do not trust the mercenaries. The infidels.

AD_WithGuard000.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard000.text: We do not need to trust them. The Absolute's Design requires many threats - not all of them of the finest fabric.

FlamingSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
FlamingSpy.text: My unexpected ally! The General was very pleased with Isobel's return. Don't worry, I told him all about you.
FlamingSpy.context: NodeContext: genuine in the first line, but in the second he sounds smug (he totally took all the credit)

AD_WithCultist.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithCultist.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithCultist.speaker: Radija
AD_WithCultist.text: By Her design. Can I assist you, Disciple?
AD_WithCultist.context: NodeContext: Polite response to religious greeting

AD_WithCultist.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithCultist.text: The General has withdrawn to his chapel above. He is not to be disturbed.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: I am free to do more for the Absolute, Disciple. Anything.
AD_WithSpy.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Would you cast yourself from the tower-top?

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: Of course. I have the Absolute's wings to catch me.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Off you go, then. I've always wanted to try those ballistas.

session_synopses.AD_WithGuard000: A patrolling guard stops and reports to Z'rell.
session_synopses.FlamingSpy: Marcus is in Moonrise after either kidnapping isobel OR being thwarted by the player.
session_synopses.AD_WithCultist: Z'rell and Radija are talking about how nobody should be allowed on the rooftop.
session_synopses.AD_WithSpy: Z'rell and Marcus are talking after Marcus has kidnapped Isobel.

Skeletons.speaker: Narrator
Skeletons.text: *You think you hear a whisper - but perhaps it was just wind draughting through a dull and empty thing.*
Skeletons.context: NodeContext: Not sure if "draughting" is correct usage but feels good for this moment - creepy wind creepily sighing through a creepy skeleton

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I'll tell you a story, True Soul. About a man who sold himself piece by piece.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: He had... everything. A wonderful wife. A brilliant daughter. They lived not far from here.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: His wife died too young. Grief tore through their home like a thief, snatching away the scent of her hair, the rustle of her skirts. But the man did not break.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: He could not break. His daughter needed him whole, after all.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: She grew up - grew strong. Challenged him. Filled his heart with such joy it supplanted all sorrow.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: When she was killed, the man... he tried to remain whole, but it wasn't possible. Do you understand?

Ketheric.speaker: Player
Ketheric.text: So the man fell to pieces.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: The pain was unbearable. All-consuming. He decided he'd do anything for reprieve.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: First, he sold himself to the goddess of loss. But the pain did not subside, no matter his obscene feats of devotion.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Then a new god came - a god who promised the man something wonderful: his daughter. Her life returned. Imagine it.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: He would have to give everything: his body and soul entire. He did not hesitate. Not for a moment.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: And the new god did as promised. The man's brilliant, beautiful daughter came back. She was whole - she was alive. But she despised the pitiful wretch her father had become.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Her hatred he could bear, perhaps, as long as she had another chance to live.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Everything I've done, everything I have built, has been to give Isobel that chance. And you, True Soul - you have squandered it.

Ketheric.speaker: Player
Ketheric.text: You brought her back once. Do it again.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I can. I will. But it is not without cost. Who will pay this time, True Soul?

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I have no mercy left in me - but it is for the Absolute to decide your fate.
Ketheric.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: It is not your time yet, blessed one.
AccessCultist.context: NodeContext: Looking us up and down, unimpressed but (barely) polite. Main note for entire dialogue is a customer service worker who knows they have to be polite, but secretly hates you.

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: The rooftop chapel is reserved for the General's private contemplation - save for those he chooses to ascend.
AccessCultist.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the doorsNodeContext: Polite facade, but secretly enjoying telling us we're not so special

AccessCultist.text: This must be the place. We have to get inside.

Altar.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player slowly kneels at altar
Altar.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player slowly kneels at altar

Altar.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar.text: Come then, True Soul. Let us pray. Hear us, Absolute!
Altar.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric crosses to stand alone at the centre of the roof, beneath the raised altar. He raises his hand, and a ring on his fist flares with light.

session_synopses.Skeletons: Animated skeleton of MyrkulThe skeletons don' talk, they don't have the animations. It's doable, but should be thought through and requested, then the scripting will have to change too.
session_synopses.AccessCultist: The Mistress of Souls won't let us pass into Ketheric's chapel until we've completed MOO quests. Her tone is vaguely respectful, but not as deferential as a True Soul is used to. When we press her on this, we'll see her contempt - True Souls might be a big deal out in the world, but not here. In truth, she is a Myrkul cultist playing her role in the church of the Absolute, secretly contemptuous of every true believer.
session_synopses.Altar: Player completed Z'rell's tasks and was granted the Audience. Ketheric told them to kneel at the altar. The tentacle will touch them and teleport them

General_SpottedUnwelcomeVisitors.speaker: Narrator
General_SpottedUnwelcomeVisitors.text: *You're not welcome in Moonrise, and your presence hasn't gone unnoticed. Time to fight... or flee.*

session_synopses.AD_Combat: Combat ADs for the drider when he moves to the top of the tower.

Guard2.speaker: Adept Merim
Guard2.text: Plenty of supplies if you're running low, True Soul.

node_data.speaker: Zealot Malik
node_data.text: That's far enough.
node_data.context: NodeContext: With cool superiority

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His thoughts invade your own, probing for purchase. Your parasite purrs in recognition.*

node_data.speaker: Zealot Malik
node_data.text: Ah, one blessed like myself. What news, True Soul?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Great news: I'm here to take your head.

node_data.speaker: Zealot Malik
node_data.text: Did you hear that, sister?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Getting ready to fight, so sinister edge.

node_data.speaker: Adept Merim
node_data.text: Did I ever.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to start - should have that edge

AD_Guards.speaker: Zealot Malik
AD_Guards.text: Before the Absolute? I was nobody.

AD_Guard001Greeting.speaker: Zealot Malik
AD_Guard001Greeting.text: You brought Balthazar back from the darkness, I hear. The General will be pleased.
AD_Guard001Greeting.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.

session_synopses.Guard2: Guard who stops you at the entrance to Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses: In this dialogue the player attempts to enter moonrise WITHOUT the drider. The guard mindmelds with player, senses their tadpole, and gladly lets them into the towers, telling them to report to Disciple Z'rell (Zuh-rELL).
session_synopses.AD_Guards: The two guards at Moonrise entrance kill time wile on duty.
session_synopses.AD_Guard001Greeting: The guard at the entrance of Moonrise welcomes the player when they return (after already been formally greeted).

Guard00.speaker: Adept Ghulen
Guard00.text: These cells won't stay empty for long. There are still so many who defy the Absolute.
Guard00.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Fervent, looking forward to more prisoners to torment.

session_synopses.Guard00: An Absolute guard at the entrance to the prison. She's the archetypal sadistic prison guard - finding the suffering of her prisoners amusing, and desperate to please her god / superiors.

AD_DUBackgroundBook.text: Tendays of dissections of a still-living victim.

PAD_Ritual.speaker: Player
PAD_Ritual.text: Ketheric's been studying something called the Apostle... but of which god?

session_synopses.PAD_Ritual: The party finds a text in Ketheric‚Äôs chamber that hints at his connection to Myrkul and his ‚Äòapostle‚Äô form. A successful religion check references death or divinity - not explicitly calling out Myrkul by name.

PAD_Use.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Use.text: *From this seat, Ketheric defied gods and raised an army for the Absolute.*
PAD_Use.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grand shot of Ketheric's hall over the player's shoulder.

PAD_Use.speaker: Player
PAD_Use.text: Don't get used to it. One taste of regal power might have you craving more.

session_synopses.PAD_Use: The player sits on Ketherics throne. They feel powerful, though their companions are not convinced. .

session_synopses.AD_ZrellCombat: Players triggered outcast state in MOO by attacking Ketheric in execution or going to the roof before time.Plays in the first combat Zrell participates when the state is active.

AD_PrisonComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_PrisonComment.text: Hohohoooo! Conditions most grim, courtesy of Ketheric Thorm.

session_synopses.AD_PrisonComment: The spirit in the amulet comments on the prison in Moonrise Towers

Vat.speaker: Narrator
Vat.text: *A wave of sick familiarity radiates from one barrel amidst the cargo.*

Vat.speaker: Narrator
Vat.text: *Tadpoles. Sleeping and scarcely aware, but echoing yours a hundredfold.*

AD_Minthara_AtDocks.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_AtDocks.text: Shipments of parasites, bound for Baldur's Gate. Half the city may be infected already.

AD_JumperGreeting.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_JumperGreeting.text: Enjoy the view. Feels like it'd stretch all the way to the Sea of Swords on a clear day. If this place ever gets a clear day.

GuardPatroller001.speaker: Adept Bel
GuardPatroller001.context: NodeContext: Nervous of us, wants to get back to patrolling

Checkpoint.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint.text: *Her thoughts invade your own, hunting for recognition. Your parasite offers it, readily.*

Checkpoint.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint.text: True Soul. A pleasure. What news from the field?

AD_ObserverWitness.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverWitness.text: Just... move on, Arden. You didn't see anything.
AD_ObserverWitness.context: NodeContext: said to himself - he's just watched one of his comrades comically executed, not for the first time. Keeping his head down.

AD_ObserverFishing.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverFishing.text: Must've found some booze among the supplies. Idiot.
AD_ObserverFishing.context: NodeContext: Irritated, speaking to comrade who's just jumped into the water and sank

session_synopses.Vat: The player has investigated the vat, showing thousands of tadpoles. They are being used to bolster their number of soldiers for their attack on Baldurs Gate. The player can destroy the Vat, depriving some of their numbers, or utter a phrase to influence whoever these tadpoles end up attached to.
session_synopses.AD_JumperGreeting: Acolyte Marls, who stands guard of the cargo at the docks, greets the player as they first pass by the docks at Moonrise.
session_synopses.GuardPatroller001: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The guard mindmelds with player, senses their tadpole, and gladly lets them into the towers, telling them to report to Disciple Z'rell (Zuh-rELL).
session_synopses.AD_ObserverWitness: The guard just witnessed a guard jump into the water.
session_synopses.AD_ObserverFishing: The Dock Guard Observer is standing peering over the dock where one of his subordinates just jumped into the water for apparently no reason. All lines are low grumbling, as if spoken to the dead man.
session_synopses.AD_Patroller000Witness: DockPatroller_000 witness DockJumper jumping into the water.

session_synopses.002: The guard standing just inside the entrance of Moonrise Towers. He is here to slightly nudge the player towards the execution room.

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Soreni
Guard02.text: All's well here. The cargo from below has already been taken to the docks.
Guard02.context: NodeContext: with a nod - you're doing menial work, and hoping not to be bothered

session_synopses.Guard02: A guard in the Moonrise Tower warehouse. Responsible for transporting cargo to the docks - it's not the most exciting job, but she's just glad to be involved.

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | I'm not welcome here, but it's safe for now. Thank you. |

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Once we leave this place, I'll make my way to your camp. |

AD_WelcomingMinthara.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_WelcomingMinthara.text: Nightwarden Minthara - your dereliction of duty has finally caught up with you.
AD_WelcomingMinthara.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

AD_FailedInterrogation.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_FailedInterrogation.text: Break them, before they call for help.
AD_FailedInterrogation.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

AD_AttackedTorturers.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_AttackedTorturers.text: You dared scar my mind, I will gut you.
AD_AttackedTorturers.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: You were adored, Minthara. Brought up from the darkness, and into the Absolute's light.
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over Minthara, speaking serenely and calmly, like a priest giving the last rites, in horrible contrast to the words she's saying

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: She cherished you. But it wasn't enough - you were distracted by your own desires.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: Bloodlust. Murder. Chaos.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: And most damning of all, an inability to follow orders.

Torture.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture.text: I obeyed to the best of my ability.
Torture.context: NodeContext: Through gritted teeth, holding back immense mental agony

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: And isn't that depressing?

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: You are nothing.

Torture.speaker: Narrator
Torture.text: *Minthara's mind connects with yours. Not strong, as you remember it, but fractured... disintegrating.*

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: Come to observe, True Soul? She is a lesson - none can rise so high that they cannot fall again.
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning from Minthara to player, having noticed their approach

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: I expected her to be dismembered. Disappointing.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: When the body suffers, we retreat into the mind. But when the mind breaks, all is lost.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: We are erasing her.

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: I've been instructed to handle this prisoner myself.
True

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: No - this is our duty.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: Peace, sister. Let us observe the True Soul's methods - perhaps we can learn from them.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: Her mind is yours. Break it.
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: they stand back from Minthara at the end of this line

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: The only thing I'm going to break is you.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: Are you quite mad? Or maybe defective.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: You won't break us. And you won't leave here alive.

AD_Torture.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Torture.text: Queen of Spiders, I beseech of you the strength to destroy my foes.
