AD_Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_Torture.text: Lolth cannot hear you. She has forsaken you.

AD_Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_Torture.text: There are no gods left to you, Minthara. You are alone.

Escaped.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped.text: I last left Moonrise as a commander in the Absolute's army, obeying the voice of a god. I thought I had found a home... and a purpose.
Escaped.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the tower we just escaped, speaking with general disgust

Escaped.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped.text: Now I leave as an exile. But you risked your life to rescue me - for that, I am grateful.

Escaped.speaker: Narrator
Escaped.text: *The artefact connects with her, pulling your minds together, and showing her all that you have seen.*

Escaped.speaker: Narrator
Escaped.text: *The Prism, your dream visitor, the protection that keeps you from obeying the Absolute, and becoming illithid. She knows it all in a moment.*

Escaped.speaker: Narrator
Escaped.text: *Her mind reels, but is no longer clouded. She accepts the truth... she has no choice.*

Escaped.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped.text: There is much we must discuss. Do you have a safe place to camp nearby?

Escaped.speaker: Player
Escaped.text: Tell her where to find your camp.

Escaped.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped.text: Goodbye for now. I will see you soon.

session_synopses.AD_WelcomingMinthara: Minthara has arrived to the torturers room. They are delighted and welcome her before they get to torture her.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The player is accompanied by Minthara and is stopped by the entrance guards. They do not think Minthara should be allowed to leave.
session_synopses.AD_FailedInterrogation: On Minthara's turn, in combat after failing to pass by an interrogating guard.
session_synopses.AD_AttackedTorturers: On Minthara's turn, when attacking the torturers.
session_synopses.Torture: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.
session_synopses.Escaped: Minthara has escaped Moonrise with the players. She is grateful and offers to move to the player camp.

DaisyAD_AttackImmortal.text: He cannot die - we must find what gives him his invulnerability before we strike!

DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated.text: It won't work - not until we find out what is keeping him from death!

session_synopses.DaisyAD_AttackImmortal: If player inflicts combat with immortal Ketheric Daisy urges to fallback and solve the problem of invulnerability first
session_synopses.DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated: If player inflicts combat with immortal Ketheric Daisy urges to fallback and solve the problem of invulnerability first

AD_GoingForBreak.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
AD_GoingForBreak.context: NodeContext: Just finished a dangerous patrol - spoken to a friend as if pleasantly surprised (a joke)

AD_GoingForBreak.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_GoingForBreak.context: NodeContext: Responding as if pleasantly surprised his friend survived.

AD_GoingForBreak.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
AD_GoingForBreak.context: NodeContext: Raised eyebrow to friend - this is what they always do

AD_GoingForBreak.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_GoingForBreak.context: NodeContext: A confirmation in response to "Drink?" from a friend.

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_OnBreak.text: Bah. Why we all still waiting around, anyway? City ain't gonna sack itself.
AD_OnBreak.context: NodeContext: Grunting in frustration, eager to get to battle

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_OnBreak.text: General's a great thinker, I hear. I suppose he's strategising.

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_OnBreak.text: War-chiefs don't plan. Either our god is stronger than all the others, or She ain't.

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_OnBreak.text: What, you gonna defect? Follow Sune of the Pretty Face?
AD_OnBreak.context: NodeContext: Mocking (Sune = SOO-nee, goddess of beauty)

session_synopses.AD_GoingForBreak: |Goblins just finished their escort job with the drider caravan. They deserve some rest.|
session_synopses.AD_OnBreak: |Goblins are on a break after escorting the drider caravan. They are now enjoying

Guard01.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
Guard01.text: Don't mind Mig and her 'meat sounds'. It's just her brain slopping around in her skull.
Guard01.context: NodeContext: Mig is an ogre complaining about 'meat sounds' - you are reluctantly sharing a room with the ogre, and explaining his weirdness away

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: You'd find better lodgings out in the war camp, True Soul.

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: I know we're all one under the Absolute, but you do not want to bunk with an ogre.
Guard02.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - this guard has seen things

session_synopses.Guard01: A guard stationed alongside Mig the ogre. Mig is complaining of hearing "meat sounds" - in actuality it's a monster moving through the walls. This guard doesn't believe him either way.
session_synopses.Guard02: A guard in the guard room of Moonrise Tower. They're growing accustomed to living and fighting alongside monstrous races.

AD_GuardsInterrupt.speaker: Mig
AD_GuardsInterrupt.text: Monster lives in this tower. Something big.

AD_GuardsInterrupt.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
AD_GuardsInterrupt.text: You're the biggest thing here. Nothing to be afraid of, lass.

AD_TentacleShaft.speaker: Player
AD_TentacleShaft.text: Something slimy seems to be dripping from the rafters above.

session_synopses.AD_GuardsInterrupt: Mig the Ogre says she hears things in the walls. The other two guards on duty beside her are unconvinced - one irritated, the other sympathetic but skeptical
session_synopses.AD_TentacleShaft: The player passed a perception check to recognise tendrils of organic matter drooping through a wall. Exploring the rafters above this spot leads to the tentacle scene.

AD_MelodiaThorm.speaker: Narrator
AD_MelodiaThorm.text: *Melodia Thorm, loving mother, beloved wife. Her light will never be forgotten.*

session_synopses.AD_MelodiaThorm: Bust of Melodia Thorm in Isobel's Room in Moonrise

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering all that is at stake...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering how close we are to the conclusion of our efforts...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: I ask you again: why am I here?
AD_Execution.context: NodeContext: Bitter vitriol in his voice.

PAD_AstarionsComment.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AstarionsComment.text: Finally. Time to see the one controlling these parasites.

PAD_AstarionsComment.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AstarionsComment.text: Maybe they can be controlled just as easily.

session_synopses.AD_Execution: Ketheric's AD before the execution. Bitter vitriol in his voice.
session_synopses.PAD_AstarionsComment: Astarion's comment after we finish talking to Ketheric and he told us to kneel at the altar.

PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.text: Dark Justiciars fell here. Those signs we saw before were no coincidence - they led us here.
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.context: NodeContext: Captivated. Arc: SH is loyal to shar. Starting to vocalise a sneaking suspicion that this temple is a legendary Sharran site, before dismissing the thought.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains: Shadowheart finds the remains of the Dark Justiciars and based on her level of knowledge will make a comment. All of them meant to build up anticipation for the Shar Temple. Can be triggered multiple times.

AD_CreepyNoises001.speaker: Object
AD_CreepyNoises001.text: She was no fun. All I wanted was to play.
AD_CreepyNoises001.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Referring to a dead githyanki the player comes across.

AD_OliverDeathScream.speaker: Oliver
AD_OliverDeathScream.text: Mummy! Daddy! Betsy! No - don't leave me!

session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises001: The player hears creepy noises on the path to the house haunted by a shadow family.
session_synopses.AD_OliverDeathScream: Death-scream of Oliver in the Oliver's Diary booster.

PAD_FoundRolan.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRolan.text: Is that Rolan? I thought he had better sense than this.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Gods damn it all. I can do nothing right - not a damn thing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: furious - mainly with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're supposed to be at Last Light.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I'm supposed to be saving Cal and Lia!
node_data.context: NodeContext: frantic, clearly worried for his siblings

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Instead, I found myself cornered by shadow-fiends and in need of rescue. From you, of all bloody people.
node_data.context: NodeContext: pissed off and taking it out on the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You were trying to help your family - you're too hard on yourself.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Or not hard enough.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I've failed Cal and Lia, again. Be on your way - I'll return to Last Light... I know when I'm outmatched.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRolan: Voice Bark that plays when the party stumbles across Rolan in the Shadowlands, after he leaves the Last Light Inn looking for his siblings.Characters are surprised to find Rolan out here, but worried for his safety.
session_synopses: Players find Rolan in SCL being attacked by the shadows after deciding to go by himself to save his siblings. After the dialog he will return to Haven

PAD_ReadResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadResearch.text: Research on the nature of the shadow curse. Good to know.

session_synopses.PAD_ReadResearch: The player reads the journal of a dead druid in SCL. The druid was researching the Shadowcurse to see if it was spreading. After reading the journal the player rolls a Nature check to parse the notes

DaisyAD_ReachTowers.text: We are approaching the Absolute. A telepathic storm is surging all around us.
And the eye of the storm lies above that tower.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text: *Night and shadow have claimed this place. Turn back.*

Underdark.text: CinematicNodeContext: The party emerges to look across the shadow-cursed lands stretching before them. A dark, grim panorama.
Underdark.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party emerges to look across the shadow-cursed lands stretching before them. A dark, grim panorama.

Underdark.speaker: Player
Underdark.text: What is this place? Makes the Underdark look like a sunlit meadow... I'm not sure I want to step in there.
Underdark.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party looks around in hushed awe,NodeContext: Reacting to view of the dark, foreboding region ahead. A little taken aback. They aren't aware of what's causing this place's affliction (a shadow curse)

PAD_Curse_2Characters.speaker: Player
PAD_Curse_2Characters.text: These shadows can pull the life from someone - but not me.

PAD_Curse_2Characters.speaker: Player
PAD_Curse_2Characters.text: I feel it, though. My very being, draining out of me.
PAD_Curse_2Characters.context: NodeContext: Affected by the shadow curse, which is draining their strength

PAD_AfterCutscene.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCutscene.text: I've never seen darkness like this before. It's unsettling.

PAD_AfterCutscene.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCutscene.text: But if this is the way to Moonrise Towers, then this is the only path I've got.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_ReachTowers: DaisyAD that plays on entering SCL from either entry point.
session_synopses.AD_Sign: Sign on the Risen Road before the Shadow Curse
session_synopses.Underdark: Players enter SCL for the first time from the underdark. Surveying the landscape, they reflect on the atmosphere and the shadow curse. The player may or may not have been previously briefed about the shadow curse by the druid Halsin
session_synopses.PAD_Curse_2Characters: Players are affected by the shadow curse. They start to lose health, and can feel the darkness starting to suck their life away - and 2 party members are available to AD about this.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCutscene: PAD for party banter when players enter SCL, after the cutscene (either SCL_EntryPoint_Mountain.lsj or SCL_EntryPoint_Underdark.lsj, depending on which entrance is used). Lines are generic enough about the shadow curse/look of the land that they work for both entrances to SCL. Two lines from one companion if only one companion present.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialog if players leaves the area where the goblin was and comes back. They will find the corpse of the goblin killed by the shadows.

AD_Goblins_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_Goblins_AtTower.text: Wonder if there's dancing down in the war camp. Feelin' frisky.
AD_Goblins_AtTower.context: NodeContext: Despite the playful phrase, makes it sound threatening.

session_synopses.AD_Goblins_AtTower: Goblins relaxing at Moonrise Towers after arriving with the Drider's caravan.

VB_Debilitated.speaker: Player
VB_Debilitated.text: This place... I feel chilled to the marrow.

PAD_InvestigatedOx.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedOx.text: Hells. Poor thing didn't deserve to die like this.
PAD_InvestigatedOx.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a dead ox at the site of an ambushed refugee caravan

PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.text: Gored to death, by the look of it.
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a tiefling who was gored to death

session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedOx: Player discovers the dead ox that was part of the tiefling refugee caravan. The ox became shadowcursed before being killed by the tieflings. The player rolls an Investigation check to understand the circumstances of the ox's death
session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedTiefling: The player finds a dead tiefling near the refugee's abandoned caravan. The tiefling was killed by the shadowcursed ox. The player rolls a Medicine check to determine the tiefling's death

PAD_ShadowlandDevastation.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowlandDevastation.text: Hells. The curse has torn open the ground itself...

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowlandDevastation: Party comments on just how destroyed the landscape is in parts of the Shadowcurse.Gale inparticular notes how the tectonic plates have even shifted.

PAD_Approach.speaker: Player
PAD_Approach.text: A dead bird. What happened to it?
PAD_Approach.context: NodeContext: Reacting to coming across a dead bird in the shadow-cursed lands.

session_synopses.PAD_Approach: A player encounters a dead bird.

AD_ScreamingInsideLantern.text: OPEN THIS CAGE YOU MUNTING ARSEHOLE!
AD_ScreamingInsideLantern.context: NodeContext: 'munting' rhymes with 'bunting', made up swear word

PAD_ReactionToPixie.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToPixie.text: Hmm, a pixie. Curious little thing.

PAD_ReactionToPixie.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToPixie.text: Not what I expected to run into in a place like this.

InsideLantern.speaker: Dolly Dolly Dolly
InsideLantern.text: Yoo-hoo! I'm ready to come out now!
InsideLantern.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds up the lantern and looks it over. A moon-like light glows from the lanternNodeContext: Seething rage, barely-disguised

InsideLantern.speaker: Player
InsideLantern.text: Ignore the pixie; you'll be needing this lamp.

session_synopses.AD_ScreamingInsideLantern: Pixie starts screaming and swearing after not being helped.
session_synopses.PAD_ReactionToPixie: Players react to the pixie inside the lantern. 2-speaker and solo speaker versions. Added reactivity depending on if the pixie was angered during the previous scene (SCL_Pixie_InsideLantern)
session_synopses.InsideLantern: The player has received a magical lantern - the Moonlantern - which protects against an evil curse. Hearing a voice from the lantern you examine it and find there's a pixie trapped inside, which gives it its power. The pixie is desperate and begs to be let out, as the lantern is killing it. If you release it, the pixie will grant you immunity from the curse, but only for one day. The pixie has two modes: Cute rhyming fairtyale Disney pixie (a put on) and evil vile little fey creature (true self)

AD_ShadowlandsComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_ShadowlandsComment.text: Darkness. Desolation. The Dark Lady's hand at work, mayhaps? HahaHA-HEE!
AD_ShadowlandsComment.context: NodeContext: Said with the laughing madness so common to the character.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowlandsComment: The spirit of the amulet comments on the state of the Shadowcurse and how it's effecting the land

AD_StartOfFight.speaker: Oliver
AD_StartOfFight.text: You should have just left me alone!

AD_StartOfFight.speaker: Oliver
AD_StartOfFight.text: Spoil my fun? I'll teach you a lesson - just you watch.

AD_Dome25PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome25PercentHP.text: Why are you doing this? All I wanted to do was play!
AD_Dome25PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player has reduced a magic dome shielding Oliver to 25% integrity)

AD_SummoningPlush.speaker: Oliver
AD_SummoningPlush.context: NodeContext: he's summoning toys to fight the players - malicious, but playful

session_synopses.AD_StartOfFight: AD from Oliver if players chase him to the TWN Center for the climax of Lifting the Curse
session_synopses.AD_Dome25PercentHP: This AD happens when you damage nightdome and bring it below 25%.
session_synopses.AD_SummoningPlush: AD that Oliver plays when he summons his Plush during the fight at the plaza in Shadow Cursed Town

PAD_ReadRobbersNote.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadRobbersNote.text: Ellie May's ring? Guess I got there before him.
PAD_ReadRobbersNote.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays if you have already found the ring when you read the robbers note

session_synopses.PAD_ReadRobbersNote: When the player reads the Skeptical Robber's note after having already discovered the grave or found the ring, they are reminded about that with this dialog. The top node is if you already found the ring. The bottom is if you read the tombstone but HAVEN'T found the ring.

000_AD_CombatStarts.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_CombatStarts.text: That's them! Kill the drider - take the Moonlantern!

000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.text: The lantern's down - we need to get it!

000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.context: InternalNodeContext: cultist' refers to the player - could be any gender

session_synopses.000_AD_CombatStarts: Start ambush combat with Harper Lassandra present
session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDropsLantern: Drider drops lantern (either being disarmed or killed)
session_synopses.000_AD_PlayerTookLantern: The Player is fighting on the side of the drider against the Harpers. The Players just picked up the lantern that Harper Lassandra wants.

session_synopses.AD_BeforeTown: Signpost between last light and town

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Here we go - if there's any of that ointment left, I could use it.

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Same here. I don't want to face whatever's out there unprotected.

PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.speaker: Player
PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.text: Hells. Torchlight won't last long here.

EmperorAD_CompanionCursed.text: Your ally is falling to the curse. Help them.

PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.text: The Dark Lady shields me - I can feel her.
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.context: NodeContext: Commenting on having divine protection from a shadow curse that affects all others

session_synopses.PAD_WantsOintment: PAD where a character who doesn't have the ointment applied steps into the shadowcurse and considers applying some. Only triggers if someone has spare ointment in their inventory. (At least one application)Plays only if 2 or more characters present: first to speak doesn't have the ointment applied on them. SH speaks first if she can.WRITER, don't forget to update the voicebark file SCL_ShadowCurse_VB_WantsOintment if you change the structure here!
session_synopses.PAD_LightsSnuffedOut: You're walking through an area where the shadow curse is strong and your torch gets snuffed out by the curse.
session_synopses.EmperorAD_CompanionCursed: Used exclusively when players have a companion left unattended/unhooked and without any protection against the curse. Goes hand in hand with a switch to turn based mode.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBlessed: Shadowheart comments on feeling Shar's protection against the curse return.

AD_LostGoods.speaker: Narrator
AD_LostGoods.text: *A pile of belongings, forsaken to the curse so that their owners could escape with their lives.*

AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.speaker: Narrator
AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.text: *Fallen members of the Emerald Enclave. Casualties in the war against Ketheric Thorm, years past.*

session_synopses.AD_LostGoods: Lost goods and piles of valuables - sacks, chests, boxes, backpacks left behind by people dashing out to save their lives.
session_synopses.AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen: There are number of pile of fallen withered skeletons in greenish armors of Emerald Enclave.They are remains from the past war with Ketheric and his Justiciars

ShadowMemory4.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory4.text: *You sense a fading echo of the person who once was. A dockhand. He did not ask for this.*

ShadowMemory20.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory20.text: *A distant memory of a man stretching his back with a groan. Another day of hauling masonry blocks done...*

ShadowMemory8.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory8.text: *She was a healer, trying to aid the wounded in the battle against the Sharrans. But there were so many...*

ShadowMemory16.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory16.text: *You sense a matriarch's flush of pride - she will soon be a grandmother, and the child will bear her name. Muldred.*

Entrance_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque3.text: *We offer ourselves to the darkness, that blessed Shar may give us her mercy.*

ShadowMemory17.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory17.text: *Callused hands work a hammer and chisel around a massive slab of rock. Months from now, a face will take shape.*

ShadowMemory9.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory9.text: *You see a man stalking slowly through the woods, bow half-drawn. If he bags a deer, the whole family will be kept fed all winter...*

ShadowMemory21.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory21.text: *You can almost taste the sour ale that once clung to this soul's breath. He was insensible when the shadows came for him.*

ShadowMemory5.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory5.text: *You glimpse a young Harper on the eve of battle against Thorm, long ago. He and his comrades toast each other in Last Light...*

ShadowMemory10.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory10.text: *In her former life, this girl played in the nearby woods. She was always the best at climbing trees.*

ShadowMemory2.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory2.text: *You can almost feel the heat from the forge. This one was once a blacksmith.*

ShadowMemory26.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory26.text: *You sense a faded memory of marching in an army against Ketheric Thorm. Victory seemed possible then.*

ShadowMemory30.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory30.text: *An echo of the past shows a man hunched over a ledger, quill in hand. Tolls collected on the Risen Road, destined for Moonrise.*

ShadowMemory31.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31.text: *You see a man drain his tankard in an inn as he listens to a Flaming Fist play the lute. He's better than his uniform might suggest.*

ShadowMemory27.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory27.text: *You can almost smell the hops and barley for yourself. This man's family always complained that his clothing reeked after work at the brewery.*

ShadowMemory3.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory3.text: *Desperate prayers to Sel√ªne, echoing from the past. They did not save him.*

ShadowMemory11.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory11.text: *You see an older woman, on her knees, scrubbing the floor of an inn. The patrons made a mess of things again the night before.*

ShadowMemory28.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory28.text: *You hear the heavy thud of a butcher's cleaver on his block, as he divides his meagre fare for those waiting. Never enough to go around.*

ShadowMemory12.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory12.text: *He had dreams of boarding a ship in Baldur's Gate, and seeing the world. But then the darkness came.*

ShadowMemory32.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory32.text: *An older man turns his head away in shame. His neighbours would not renounce Sel√ªne - now they hang in the town square.*

ShadowMemory24.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory24.text: *A strange feeling of resentment comes to you. A travelling merchant, sick of this route. Sick of the tolls eating away his profits.*

ShadowMemory1.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory1.text: *A faded memory of a boy and girl sharing their first kiss. Your own heart almost flutters in tune with theirs.*

ShadowMemory25.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory25.text: *You see an old boot, balanced upside down on a cobbler's knee, as he taps the final nail into the new sole. Good as new.*

ShadowMemory33.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory33.text: *You feel a rush of outrage. This woman worshipped Shar to the end - so why does the Nightsinger's curse not spare her...?*

ShadowMemory13.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory13.text: *You sense a young woman, gazing at Moonrise Towers in awe. Perhaps one day she will get to gaze out from atop it, she hopes.*

ShadowMemory29.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory29.text: *You see a mother sitting by her child's bedside, listening to his sickly breathing as he sleeps.*

ShadowMemory6.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory6.text: *Thoughts of baby names. She did not wish for her first born to be named after her mother-in-law. Muldred. Ugh.*

ShadowMemory15.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory15.text: *You sense a swell of grief. Before the shadows took her, this woman mourned someone lost in battle.*

session_synopses.ShadowMemory4: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory20: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.

session_synopses.ShadowMemory1: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory25: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory33: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory13: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory29: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory6: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory15: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: If you intend to stray from Moonrise while Ketheric still lives, I shall remain at camp, strategising his downfall.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: I have unfinished business to attend to before dealing with Ketheric.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: I do not. All that I did before you rescued me was as a puppet of the Absolute - it is behind me. Until Ketheric falls, only vengeance remains.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Minthara tells the player her business is in SCL now and she will not leave.

ShadarKai.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai.context: CinematicNodeContext: Using SWD on the corpse of a dwarf. NodeContext: Shadar-Kai speaks in a cold, calculated tone.

ShadarKai.speaker: Madeline
ShadarKai.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse CollapsesNodeContext: Speak with dead style

ShadarKai.speaker: Player
ShadarKai.text: Not many people out here in the darkness.

ShadarKai.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai.text: I am not 'people'. Though many would question how wise it is to approach a stranger in the dark. Be on your way.

Memories.speaker: Player
Memories.text: What do I need to do?

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: I seek a record of this one's crimes - a ledger written in her own hand. With it, I can summon her spirit - and force her to face trial.

Memories.speaker: Player
Memories.text: What do you get out of it?

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: The joy of bringing suffering to the unpunished. Her victims deserve closure, and the ledger is key.

Madeline_SwD.speaker: Narrator
Madeline_SwD.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Raven_AD_Bye.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_Bye.text: I'd say bye, but you'll be dead soon! Hah!
Raven_AD_Bye.context: NodeContext: cruel and vicious, big laugh at the end

session_synopses.ShadarKai: You talk to a shadar-kai from the shadowfell. He tasks you with collecting memories from the dead.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.Memories: The player has delivered Madeline's ledger to He Who Was. The shadar-kai uses the book to channel her spirit. Player can punish her, making her stab herself the way her friends died, verbally admonish her, or forgive her.
session_synopses.Madeline_SwD: Short SWD with Madeline, Question Limit already reached because the shadar kai has been talking to her already when players approach.
session_synopses.Raven_AD_Bye: A concluding AD by the Raven when players completed the quest, before Raven disappears.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: I cannot venture back with you - now that I am in a position to fight the curse, I must stay here and see it through.
StayInSCL.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. Halsin doesn't want to backtrack to previous regions while he's close to achieving his goals.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: What if I need you by my side?

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: If you truly need to retread your steps, then you will have little need for me there. You are more formidable than anything that lies in our wake.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: I must continue to investigate the curse - this may be my last chance. I shall await your return when you are ready to continue.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Halsin tells the player his business is in SCL now and he will not leave.

PAD_Plaque.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading the text of an ancient plaque outside a room in the Temple of Shar

session_synopses.PAD_Plaque: A plaque outside a room in the Temple of Shar. The orthon has since made this area his lair, but the plaque refers to its original purpose.

CINE_NightsongsDeath.text: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'
CINE_NightsongsDeath.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'

CINE_NightsongsDeath.text: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.
CINE_NightsongsDeath.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.

session_synopses.CINE_NightsongsDeath: After killing Nightsong the player sees the aftermath in Last Light

AD_AlarmStatues.text: Shar's warriors must not be caught, must not be tricked. Only loss awaits the unworthy.

session_synopses.AD_AlarmStatues: The player has been spotted by one of the statues that control the traps at the Shar Temple's main junction. The player is trapped in a room and has an item taken from them as 'punishment'. Note that this trap is more of a training challenge for Shar recruits than it is a security system.

PAD_SpearLoot.speaker: Player
PAD_SpearLoot.text: This is no common spear... It must be the one that Shadowheart is supposed to find.

AD_SilencePlayer.context: NodeContext: Creepy ghost-whisper, spoken in combat.

session_synopses.PAD_SpearLoot: Voicebark when picking up the Spear of the Night. A sacred Sharran relic and vital for Shadowheart's quest to kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.AD_SilencePlayer: Combat reaction for the Dark Justiciar ghosts in the Silent Library. When the player disturbs them they will silence the player . On the third disturbance they become hostile

PAD_RecognisedSharTemple.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognisedSharTemple.text: Some sort of temple? Looks abandoned.

session_synopses.PAD_RecognisedSharTemple: When the player first enters the Shar Temple they roll History to recognise it as the Gauntlet of Shar - an infamous training ground. If the player is Shadowheart, a Sharran, or a Selunite they automatically succeed

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A bed made of corpses. Disgusting and uncomfortable.

session_synopses.PAD: Players reacts with disgust to the Orthon's bed

NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.speaker: Balthazar
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.text: A cheap attack, just as I'm finally reunited with my masterwork? This will not stand.
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.context: InternalNodeContext: Balthazar is hostile to the player as they attacked him before the normal scene flow triggered.NodeContext: Furious.

session_synopses.NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro: Balthazar responds to the player's attack before becoming hostile

TrialsPlaque1.speaker: Narrator
TrialsPlaque1.text: *Brave the Gauntlet of Lady Shar. Test body, mind, and spirit with Her trials. Glory awaits the few who succeed.*

session_synopses.TrialsPlaque1: This is a narrator AD on a long vertical plaque that contains a longer scripture. It is placed before the section of the temple that is dedicated to trials areas, so it can be a motivational guideline to what expects ahead.
session_synopses.NightsongPrison_Plaque1: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.

PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss.speaker: Player
PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss.text: There was magic within this mirror once... consuming magic. But it's shattered, now.
PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss.context: InternalNodeContext: Played when Medicine check succeeds.NodeContext: Shadowheart: deja vu/slightly unnerved (looking at a broken magical mirror, similar to one that took her memories previously)

AD_ShutteredMirrorOfLoss.speaker: Narrator
AD_ShutteredMirrorOfLoss.text: *Gazing into the broken mirror serves no purpose. The reflection it offers is like a dizzying kaleidoscope.*

session_synopses.PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss: In Shar temple HQ player approaches shuttered Mirror of Loss and rolls arcana check
session_synopses.AD_ShutteredMirrorOfLoss: Narrator AD on Shattered Mirror of Loss in Shar's temple in Act 2

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: Countless initiates walked these halls once, seeking to become Dark Justiciars.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: I will follow in their path. I will succeed.

PAD_ShadowheartIntro.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartIntro.text: I shall prove myself worthy, Lady Shar.

AD_LightTrialShadow.speaker: Shadow, Shadow
AD_LightTrialShadow.text: A true child of the Nightsinger embraces the shadows and passes unseen.

PAD_PathOfDarknessFirstWarning.text: Unfortunate. Fail twice more, and my embrace may elude you.

PAD_SpotGem.speaker: Player
PAD_SpotGem.text: A gem. Looks like it might fit in the altar from before.
PAD_SpotGem.context: NodeContext: Karlach note: open to interpretation (to mean 'hey, I spotted it!)  but inspired by jimmy durante

PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.speaker: Player
PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.text: This must be what that book meant. I need to get across - and that means remembering where these platforms are.

PAD_PathOfDarknessSecondWarning.text: Disappointing. Succeed or fail, the next attempt shall be the last.

PAD_HaveAllGems.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_HaveAllGems.text: That's the last one. The inner sanctum is within reach now.

PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint.speaker: Player
PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint.text: Lady Shar values those that can remain unseen and can still obtain what they want. Stealth is a virtue derived from her very essence.
PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint.context: NodeContext: Reverent, as if quoting religious teachings from memory. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiar: Shadowheart is walking along the corridors of the trials and is clearly excited about the prospect of finally proving herself worthy.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_TortureRoomPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartIntro: Shadowheart answers the Shar statue with affirmation.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessFirstWarning: Shar warns player that they only have two attempts left.
session_synopses.PAD_SpotGem: The player notices one of the Trial Gems and points it out. If the player knows that the altar requires the gems, they will reiterate the gem's use. Reactivity for finding additional gems subsequently.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessHint: The player comments after possibly figuring out a clue to successfully completing one of the trials in the Temple of Shar. They must safely cross the room while remembering where the platforms along the way are.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessSecondWarning: Shar warns player that they only have one attempt left.
session_synopses.PAD_HaveAllGems: Shadowheart reveals her anticipation and her eagerness to proceed once all trial gems have been collected to open the way to Nightsong.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint: The player speaks up on entering one of the trial areas in the temple of Shar. If they had previously read a book in the library area, they'll have an idea of what they need to do (navigate the maze and get through the locked door on the far side without being detected/setting off a trap). Otherwise they'll be none the wiser.

AD_MerregonAndOrthon.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MerregonAndOrthon.text: Keep your weapons sharp - our prey could reveal itself any time.

AD_MerregonAndOrthon.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MerregonAndOrthon.text: Be ready, or I'll kill you myself.

session_synopses.AD_MerregonAndOrthon: The orthon occasionally speaks to one of his merregon footsoldiers after the trespass scene has ended. The orthon is fed up, irritable, The merregon is incapable of speech and provides only grunts, gasps and involuntary sounds.

AD_ScoutsRetreat.text: You tread where you are not wanted - leave.
AD_ScoutsRetreat.context: NodeContext: Raspy, undead. Warning off an exploring player
NodeContext: Raspy, undead. Alarm, supernaturally sensing danger (in the broader region of a large underground temple rather than right before them)

PAD_OnTurn.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_OnTurn.text: Why do Lady Shar's dead attack? Am I being tested...?
PAD_OnTurn.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Spectres allied to Shar are attacking her in a Shar temple.

session_synopses.AD_ScoutsRetreat: The Tadpoled Skeleton Scouts spot the player and give them a brief warning before noticing the Shadowquake and running
session_synopses.PAD_OnTurn: Shadowheart expresses some conflicting feelings about fighting against the temple's defenders.

PAD_MyrkulSymbol.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_KethericsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Isobel. That's the name of the cleric at Last Light Inn, right?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Can she possibly be Ketheric's daughter?

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Balthazar, a necromancer lap dog of Ketheric Thorm's.

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Who knows what he may have up his rotten sleeve.

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.text: That disc looks like it can move - a way forward?

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.text: Where will it bring us, though?

PAD_NecromancersRoom.speaker: Player
PAD_NecromancersRoom.text: Bones everywhere... Someone's been engaging in dark rituals here.
PAD_NecromancersRoom.context: NodeContext: Astarion; as in 'water water everywhere, but not a drop to drink' (referring to a large amount of skeletons on display in a tomb

PAD_Mural_001.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_001.text: *Ketheric lost his daughter, but the bastard knows why you lost everything.*

PAD_Mural_002.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_002.text: Ketheric Thorm, leading Shar's forces. Quite the about-face for a warrior of Sel√ªne.

session_synopses.PAD_MyrkulSymbol: Players enter the room where the symbol of Myrkul lies on the floor. Hard religion DC before the PAD plays.
session_synopses.PAD_MakeshiftVessel: Players find a vessel with a half-formed humanoid shape gestating inside and reacts accordingly. The being is just inert flesh and cannot speak.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsMap: Players find the map Ketheric had inside the mausoleum. It shows  the entrance to the Shar Temple (behind Isobel's tomb) and has notes on an attack.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque: PAD for characters reacting to finding Isobels plaque in the Ketheric Mausoleum. Has 3 reaction states:- Already know Ketheric is Isobel's Father- Don't know aboutfamily relationship but have met Isobel- Don't know about family relationship and haven't met Isobel
session_synopses.PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro: Party reacts to a magic-mouth skull that projects Balthazar's voice, warning them to leave.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundDisc_2Players: Players find the disc at the mausoleum that leads to the Shar temple.
session_synopses.PAD_NecromancersRoom: Players enter for the first time inside the necromancer's room at the mausoleum. Bones are scattered about and arranged into strange totems, in a sign someone has been dabbling in dark magic.
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_001: Player interacts with the second mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the second piece of the story. This mural depicts Ketheric Thorm mourning at the tomb of his daughter (Isobel, though this is not revealed by the mural). The player's comment varies, depending on if they've met Ketheric or not.
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_002: Player interacts with the third mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the final piece of the story. This mural depicts Ketheric Thorm, along with a Sharran army, standing before the corrupted version of Moonrise Towers. Player response varies, depending on if they've seen Ketheric or not. (note: do NOT refer to Moonrise towers by name in these responses, as awareness is not guaranteed)

AD_MonitorLeaves.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeaves.text: You cannot harm me, but you can irritate me. Goodbye.
AD_MonitorLeaves.context: NodeContext: mildly irritated, said right before he teleports away

session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeaves: Raphael leaves while at the front of Shar Temple, in case he is attacked.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The bowl contains an ancient, rust-coloured bloodstain. It forms a neat disc, as if spilled calmly and willingly.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue.  Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the trial statue to being the path of darkness/invisible platform trial.

AD_TurnsAgainstPlayer.speaker: Flesh
AD_TurnsAgainstPlayer.context: InternalNodeContext: The flesh golem has been summoned by the player to attack one of the golem's allies, and it isn't happy. SFX onlyNodeContext: Angry roar from a flesh golem.

AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse.speaker: Player
AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse.text: Not keen on fighting its allies. Should've figured.

session_synopses.AD_TurnsAgainstPlayer: Player summons flesh golem but the player's enemies are the golem's allies.
session_synopses.AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse: Player summons flesh golem but the player's enemies are the golem's allies. Player character comments on this to clarify this to the actual player

session_synopses.AD_WaitingAtGraveyard: Raphael is waiting at the graveyard for the players to warn them about a danger that's behind the door (the Orthon and his party inside the Shar temple).

PAD_TriggeredShadows.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredShadows.text: So cold... there's something coming. I can feel it in the shadows...
PAD_TriggeredShadows.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers after the player is teleported into the corpse pit in the Shar Temple.NodeContext: Dread and unease.

session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredShadows: After being teleported into a pit filled with bones, the player notices shadows gathering around them as the air gets colder. The player should feel a sense of dread

PAD_TempleApproach.speaker: Player
PAD_TempleApproach.text: Piles of bodies - very old, by the looks of them.

session_synopses.PAD_TempleApproach: Party approaches the Shar Temple and notices the Dark Justiciar corpses.

OnEnter.speaker: Player
OnEnter.text: Dark and freezing. What's hidden down here?

Sarcophagus1Plaque.speaker: Narrator
Sarcophagus1Plaque.text: *In darkness, beauty is equal and wealth unseen.*
Sarcophagus1Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque in the Shadow Temple.

Sarcophagus2Plaque.speaker: Narrator
Sarcophagus2Plaque.text: *The reign of night comes in a thousand falling leaves.*
Sarcophagus2Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque in the temple of shadow.

session_synopses.OnEnter: Player reaction upon descending into the Shar Temple for the first time.
session_synopses.Sarcophagus1Plaque: A plaque on one of Shar's sarcophagi.
session_synopses.Sarcophagus2Plaque: A sarcophagus plaque in Shar's temple.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A small prickle of dread finds your heart as you look upon the altar.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of Shar.

session_synopses: The player discovers an altar in the temple of Shar. They can choose to pray at it, with the chance to receive a buff or debuff depending on the outcome of a religion check. Shar and Selune tags automatically get buff and debuff respectively. Avatar Shadowheart gets a unique and ambigous outcome, casting some doubt on her standing with her goddess.

PAD_MausoleumEntry.speaker: Player
PAD_MausoleumEntry.text: These sigils... what were they for?

session_synopses.PAD_MausoleumEntry: On approaching the Thorm Mausoleum in SCL, characters comment on the sigils placed around the entrance of the Mausoleum. Halsin, Minthara, Shadowheart, Druids and Selune followers have more context on what they are seeing.

AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.speaker: Ch'r'ai Tska'an
AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.text: W'wargaz failed to kill you. I won't make the same mistake!

AD_Caster_000_TakingTurn_002.speaker: Ch'r'ai Tska'an
AD_Caster_000_TakingTurn_002.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith's will above all - cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith

PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction.speaker: Player
PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction.text: Gith hunters. That must be why that device sounded out.

session_synopses.Melee_000_Dead: SwD dialog for S_TWN_VlaakithAttack_Melee_000. Players are ambushed by a group of giths sent by Vlaakith to follow up on her threats.https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/browse/GUS-210886
session_synopses.PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction: Players realize the Gith Radar must have beeped to alert them about the incoming Gith attack.Tries to play on Laezel first if she is nearby and available.

PAD_DoorSpotted.speaker: Player
PAD_DoorSpotted.text: Strange - the dust on the leftmost door has been wiped clean.

session_synopses.PAD_DoorSpotted: The player discovers a door to the hideout where an Aasimar Harper had survived longer than most would in the curse.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.context: NodeContext: RYTH-win. Like rye bread, not wreath. TH like in 'thick', not like in 'those'.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *The curse has been lifted, the lands cleansed of the shadows. Ketheric's reign of living death is over.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players leave SCL by the Risen Road. They look back to see beams of light breaking through the clouds.-The curse has been lifted. The clouds above part, and a powerful beam of moonlight shines through and illuminates the town centre where the statue of Ketheric stood. It is now shattered.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *Your courage has been tested, and in this, at least, you have triumphed.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut to close up of the shattered statue. An enormous silver tree bursts through the ground where the statue once stood, silver leaves/fruits sprouting, and the light from above intensifies as the shadows disperse.

LeavingAct.text: CinematicNodeContext: Cut back to party, with Halsin in shot, looking across the rejuvenating region. Halsin takes front and centre, looking back across the 'healed'vista, overjoyed, and then the party turn and continue their journey
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut back to party, with Halsin in shot, looking across the rejuvenating region. Halsin takes front and centre, looking back across the 'healed'vista, overjoyed, and then the party turn and continue their journey

PAD_ArmyLeft.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmyLeft.text: The Absolute's armies are on the march - and Baldur's Gate is their target.

session_synopses.LeavingAct: Scene of players leaving SCL to travel to Intermezzo. This scene triggers when the party leave Moonrise Tower after defeating Ketheric. There are two variants. One where the curse has been lifted, one where the curse hasn't been lifted.If the curse has been lifted, Halsin and/or Art Cullagh will be present at Moonrise if alive, and will tell players that the quest has succeeded, and that when they leave Moonrise, they'll see the restults. They tell you to wrap up your business here first. This happens in the dialogues for those characters, not here.If the curse hasn't been lifted, players see a vista of the shadow-cursed lands on leaving Moonrise, and move on toward the Risen Road.
session_synopses.PAD_ArmyLeft: Comment on how the absolute army left. Reactivity if you saw them previously or not.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.text: IF YOU WILL NOT GIVE, THEN I WILL TAKE!

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.text: YOU BROUGHT VIOLENCE. UNACCEPTABLE. BUT ALL CAN BE FORGIVEN. FOR THE RIGHT PRICE.
TollhouseMaster.context: NodeContext: howling with anger on first phrases - more reasonable on last two phrases, hoping to get some cash out of the situation

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spotting you, Gerringothe lurches forward.NodeContext: a desperate, cacophonous howl

PAD_CormyrCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_CormyrCrate.text: Silks from Cormyr, it says. Empty, though.

AD_SafeSkeleton.speaker: Narrator
AD_SafeSkeleton.text: *A forgotten soul, trapped in a safe - but who put them there, and why?*

PAD_DalelandsCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_DalelandsCrate.text: Cheese from the Dalelands. Or what's left of it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They gave me what they had. Should I have let them leave?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Yes. But I guess you didn't.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: No. I thought there might be more to take. Hidden inside.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: I opened them. Searched inside them.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Why would you do something like that?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Some wouldn't pay their dues. Some couldn't.
Face_Guilt.context: NodeContext: Rising disgust with each sentence - but a twinge of malice with the last few words

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They paid a different price in the end.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Perhaps you'd feel less guilty if you paid for your crimes too.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Yes, yes. I have gold. So much gold. Take it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Take it all, whatever the cost.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.text: NO MORE TAKING. GIVE. GIVE. GIVE!

PAD_ThayCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_ThayCrate.text: All the way from Thay. Jewels and gems, probably - one's still in there.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: Crates and caravans. Must be where tolls were collected.

Face_Heartlessness.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
Face_Heartlessness.text: You'll find much of sentimental value among the confiscated goods. That is to say - junk.
Face_Heartlessness.context: InternalNodeContext: The visage is disgusted at how little people had. Full poverty-shaming (because it wanted more.)

PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.text: Well, we're not getting in this way.

PAD_BlockedDoor.speaker: Player
PAD_BlockedDoor.text: Forget it - it's blocked from behind.

Face_Greed.speaker: Visage of Greed
Face_Greed.text: Leave it. LEAVE IT. It's MINE.

PAD_TollmasterDead.speaker: Player
PAD_TollmasterDead.text: Free from the curse, now - perhaps she'll find peace.

session_synopses.TollhouseMaster: Dialogue with the Toll collector.She will continuously, endlessly demand gold from the player. You can convince her to let you pass (hard persuade), or you will have to fight  (once you stop giving it gold, or once you run out of gold).
session_synopses.AD_Face_Regret: The Visage of Regret is standing near a window that is looking at the harbor and regreting about not leaving this town.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Regret, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_CormyrCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Cormyr.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseMaster: Tollhouse, Tollhouse Collector as she's hanging around by herself.
session_synopses.AD_SafeSkeleton: Player clicks on the skeleton that locked himself in the heavy safe in Tollhouse. This was am employee of Tollhouse and this way he hoped to wait out the fallout of Shadowcurse. But have died in that safe in dramatic way.
session_synopses.AD_Face_Cowardice: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it. Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Cowardice, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_DalelandsCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Dalelands.
session_synopses.Face_Guilt: The Visage of Guilt, hovering in front of several skeletons (dead adventurers that found their end by the hands of the Tollhouse Collector).
session_synopses.AD_ConfiscatedItemsPlaque: Plaque in the Tollhouse, outside a room full of confiscated items.
session_synopses.PAD_ThayCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Thay.
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Tollhouse in SCL
session_synopses.Face_Heartlessness: The Visage of Heartlesness is standing near some shelves with goods that it took from people.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed: You've just clicked on a plaque beside a door in the Tollhouse, which tells you that room is for confiscated items. The way into the room is blocked by vegetation/fallen masonry (don't be specific).
session_synopses.PAD_BlockedDoor: PAD, happens when you click on a door in the tollhouse that is blocked from the other side.
session_synopses.Face_Greed: This Visage of Greed is standing in front of a room full of items it confiscated that became inaccessible once the shadows and vines moved in and blocked the room off.
session_synopses.PAD_TollmasterDead: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Tollmaster that went crazy about gold

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Reithwin House of Healing. Presiding Surgeon: Malus Thorm.*

Korrilla.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla.text: Tr-tread carefully. You are still... necessary.
Korrilla.context: NodeContext: the ellipses and hyphens here are to denote her struggling to get the words out as she's afflicted with shadowcurse

session_synopses.Korrilla: This is a fallback one-liner. In case the Player manages to approach her an initiate dialog in TWN, Korrilla gives a cryptic one-liner to the player. No Hasmet node is needed, as she teleports away right after.She would be struggling with the shadow curse as she says this line.

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: Rambling nonsense. Why someone would be drawn to this is beyond me.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on reading"Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she reads the book or when another character does that.

PAD_Entrance_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P.text: See that symbol on the ground? This was a masons' guild.

PAD_Entrance_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P.text: That explains the unfinished statues. The impaled skeletons, not so much.

session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_2P: VB that is played when you approach the Mason's Guild in SCL.Version for 2 characters.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Hauliers and merchants wanted. Sail the silvery seas! Gaze upon the Gate! No experience required.*

session_synopses.AD: "Help Wanted" poster in the Cursed Town.

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: A Sel√ªne prayer book. Hmm, well she didn't answer any prayers from this place.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on picking up "Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she picks up the book or when another character does that.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *The corpse is saturated with darkness, flesh and bone corrupted by a dense concentration of Shadow Weave. Sharran magic, summoned from beyond the Weave's boundaries. Beyond Mystra's control.*
LootBoss.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of dark shadow magic reflecting flashing over Gale's face. Gale reacts.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *Left alone, its corruption will leak and spread. You could nullify it, preventing such harm as Mystra would want. Or you could absorb it, tasting Shar's forbidden magic for yourself.*

LootBoss.speaker: Gale
LootBoss.text: Cleanse the corpse. Destroy this tainted power.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *A blast of purest Weave is enough to banish the shadow magic trapped beneath the corpse's skin.*
LootBoss.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale focuses. Bright, white VFX (reading as morally good).

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *As its blight fades, you feel a lightness rush in to take its place - Mystra. A taste of what you lost and of what awaits you for fulfilling her purpose.*

session_synopses.LootBoss: Gale (or someone near Gale) has attempted to loot a corpse and Gale realises the evil possibilities.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*Here - House of Healing
West - Baldur's Gate
East - Central Square*

PAD_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_1P.text: Prayers, charms, battle cries - the Harpers' work. They were primed for combat.

session_synopses.PAD_1P: AD about a wall with protective charms and prayers written by Harpers attacking Ketheric's Outpost.

PAD_Warning.speaker: Player
PAD_Warning.text: Clustered fires and tents - the Absolute's army is camped here. Better not press my luck.

PAD_Arrested.speaker: Player
PAD_Arrested.text: Well. This is quite the mess you've gotten us into.
PAD_Arrested.context: InternalNodeContext: If the first char chose to procceed in TWN_MarchingArmy_Arrest then here the second char makes a sarcastic comments about it (like, "you really thought they wouldn't catch us")

session_synopses.PAD_Warning: The player approaches an area with a lot of tents & camp fires. It's the army of the Aboslute. The character comments that it's better to keep a safe distance from them.
session_synopses.PAD_Arrested: The dialog after we got arrested and thrown in Moonrise Prison / Corpse Pit. The companion (if present) is sarcastic about our previous statement (before being captured) where we said that we would be able to sneak past the army without any issues.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*Here - The Waning Moon
North - Central Square
East - Reithwin Tollhouse*

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*North - North Reithwin
East - Reithwin Tollhouse
South - Moonrise Towers
West - The Waning Moon*

AD_FakeMasonBones.speaker: Narrator
AD_FakeMasonBones.text: *These bones appear to have come from a collection of different skeletons.*

session_synopses.AD_FakeMasonBones: | In SCL - TOWN - Masonry there is a pile of crashed bones on display. The plaque nearby suggests these are the bones of the head Mason who had conspiracy agains Sharrans. Player can spot here that something is off with these bones - like the skeletons contains bones of different people |
